ai.summary: A 14.6 km circular hike around Warren Hill starting and finishing near Loddon in the UK. The route combines open fields, woodland and quiet country lanes, rated moderate for hikers with a steady pace and solid navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including rural tracks, grassy paths, farm lanes and some surfaced sections. Gentle ascents to Warren Hill with gates and stiles; surfaces can be uneven or muddy after rain; expect exposed spots and shaded woodland areas.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather and daylight hours; carry a map or GPS and inform someone of your plans and expected return. Wear sturdy boots, bring waterproofs and extra layers, carry water and snacks; respect livestock and gates/stiles; stay on public paths and exercise caution on uneven ground.
recommended_gear: Hat and sun protection when sunny
Extra warm layer for cooler days
Headlamp or charged phone with battery bank
Phone charged with offline map or navigation app
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March to October) is ideal; route can be doable in winter with appropriate clothing and daylight considerations.
